        <choiceInteraction responseIdentifier="RESPONSE" shuffle="true" maxChoices="0">

            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">1.20 x 1024 molecules</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="D" fixed="false">1.80 x 1024 molecules</simpleChoice>
        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>
</assessmentItem>

Only a few particles bounced off or back.  Which conclusion was the direct result of the gold foil experiment?</prompt>
            <simpleChoice identifier="A" fixed="false">An atom is composed of at least three types of subatomic particles which occupy the greatest volume with low mass.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="B" fixed="false">An atom is mostly empty space, with a very small positively charged nucleus that contains most of the mass of the atom.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">A electron has a positive charge and is located inside the nucleus and contains the smallest volume with the lowest mass.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="D" fixed="false">The electron cloud has a large number of slow moving positively charged particles in a large volume with high mass.</simpleChoice>
        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>

    <itemBody>
        <choiceInteraction responseIdentifier="RESPONSE" shuffle="true" maxChoices="0">
            <prompt>A bond can form between a sodium atom and a chlorine atom.  Which of the following best describes the formation of the bond?</prompt>

            <simpleChoice identifier="B" fixed="false">Shared to form a covalent bond.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">Transferred to form an ionic bond.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="D" fixed="false">Transferred to form a covalent bond.</simpleChoice>
        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>
</assessmentItem>
title: A bond can form between a sodium atom and a chlorine atom.  Which of the following best describes the formation of the bond?

itemData:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<assessmentItem xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imsqti_v2p1"
                xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"

                title="" adaptive="false" timeDependent="false">

        <correctResponse>
            <value>A</value>
        </correctResponse>
    </responseDeclaration>
    <outcomeDeclaration identifier="SCORE" cardinality="single" baseType="float"/>
    <itemBody>
        <choiceInteraction responseIdentifier="RESPONSE" shuffle="true" maxChoices="0">
            <prompt>How does iron lower the activation energy and affect the reaction rate of nitrogen (N2) and hydrogen (H2) in the production of ammonia (NH3)?</prompt>
            <simpleChoice identifier="A" fixed="false">Iron increases the reaction rate by acting as a site on which nitrogen and hydrogen can more easily bond to form ammonia.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="B" fixed="false">Iron increases the temperature of the solution to accelerate nitrogen and hydrogen atoms to speeds high enough to form ammonia.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">Iron increases the ability for nitrogen and hydrogen to break apart into ions so the likelihood to form ammonia is increased.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="D" fixed="false">Iron increases the nitrogen and hydrogen by occupying a larger percentage of the solution forcing the reaction to proceed.</simpleChoice>
        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>
</assessmentItem>
title: How does iron lower the activation energy and affect the reaction rate of nitrogen (N2) and hydrogen (H2) in the production of ammonia (NH3)?

            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">The reaction stops completely because all the nitrogen and hydrogen are consumed.</simpleChoice>

        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>

title: Nitrogen and hydrogen are used to make ammonia.  A worker decides to purchase a large amount of ammonia.  The worker pours it into the existing container of ammonia.  What happens to the reaction?

        <choiceInteraction responseIdentifier="RESPONSE" shuffle="true" maxChoices="0">
            <prompt>DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) is a large biological molecule containing covalent bonds.   Which of the following statements is NOT true about covalent bonds?</prompt>
            <simpleChoice identifier="A" fixed="false">Covalent bonds create long chains by exchanging electrons between atoms.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="B" fixed="false">Covalent bonds are formed when the molecule is made up entirely of non-metals.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="C" fixed="false">Covalent bonds are formed when valence electrons are shared between atoms.</simpleChoice>
            <simpleChoice identifier="D" fixed="false">Covalent bonds usually follow the octet rule as represented by Lewis structures.</simpleChoice>
        </choiceInteraction>
    </itemBody>
</assessmentItem>
title: DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) is a large biological molecule containing covalent bonds.   Which of the following statements is NOT true about covalent bonds?
